docs.lead_paragraph: Cuba’s success in limiting the epidemic stems partly from harsh early tactics and universal basic health care.

headline.seo: A Regime’s Tight Grip: Lessons From Cuba in AIDS Control
headline.main: A Regime’s Tight Grip on AIDS
headline.print_headline: A Regime’s Tight Grip on AIDS

docs.abstract: Cuba's success in limiting its AIDS epidemic stems from a number of factors, most notably a harsh quarantine system that existed until 1993; rates have also dropped off due to rigorous HIV testing under the country's universal basic health care system, free condoms and graphic safe-sex education for teenagers.
docs.snippet: Cuba’s success in limiting the epidemic stems partly from harsh early tactics and universal basic health care.
